Reviews.Title: “Excellent and business-friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: slurer73
Reviews.Content: Stayed there during MWC 2012 and was a delight. Interiors were well furnished with a modern touch while the balcony was nice to enjoy the cold breeze. My experiences with the AC chain have been very pleasant. The suites were well equipped with amenities and kept cleaned during my stay. Front office assistance was great with transportation arrangements and providing excellent directions. Internet connectivity was the biggest concern but I had no problems at all connecting at the lobby during evenings. Good option considering its proximity to the Metro and supermarket.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Jan-from-Denmark
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three night in a small suite. It was very nice, clean and comfortable. I am already making my reservation here for the nexy visit to Barcelona. The reason I am notrating it 5 is that the breakfast was a little boring - no egg, bacon or anything cooked. And that the reception did not speak english - but only spanish that I do not speak - when I checked out. But these are really minor things in anoverall very good experience

Reviews.Title: “Thrilled with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Niall S
Reviews.Content: To be honest after reading some of the reviews I was concerned BUT we needed to stay in the area. The Princess Sofia was full so I booked a room here. I used one of the booking sites so I wasn't expecting a great experience. The room was excellent. I requested a cot for an infant and it was waiting for us. The suite was large and well furnished. The staff were very very helpful at all times. The one area where I felt could be addressed was the price of the food in the restaurant. Very pricy for what was delivered BUT the beer was ice cold. If going back to Barcelona this hotel will be my first port of call.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for your money”
Reviews.Author: etokyo
Reviews.Content: Rooms are average... internet connection is poor... but service is great and made up for any shortcomings.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and spacious rooms, but a few problems”
Reviews.Author: Kukusik
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this place for 2 weeks on a business trip and the hotel was chosen mostly due to a convenient location. I was happy with the spacious rooms and great breakfast, but there were a few problems that interfered with my business trip: - Internet connection was slow or non-existent due to challenges from Telefonica, the service provider; it was possible to work from the lobby as many of us did, where the connection was good - There was water dripping from the ceiling in the bathroom, so you had to keep towels on the sink and floor in order not to hear "drip, drip" at night. I was offered to change the room as this was not something that could have been fixed, but I just think that no rooms should have this problem to begin with. - I had a phone stolen from my room, and the management did address the issue, they compensated for one night stay, which ended up being 1/4 of expenses that I incurred due to the missing phone (someone has ran up my bill). So, lock your valuables - laptop, phone etc. There are no guarantees that it will stay safe otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Tired, shabby and plastic - a budget experience”
Reviews.Author: james b
Reviews.Content: I suppose I should have guessed from the price that the hotel wouldn't be all that good, but sadly I was taken in by the high quality photos. Big was far from beautiful in the case of the AC Victoria Suites. The room was tired and depressing. Plastic and cheap materials everywhere. In the bathroom, numerous signs of wear and botched touching up. This budget experience was also reflected in other areas. Whilst I expect to pay extra for things like wifi when staying in a low-cost hotel, I don't expect to do so when having what AC describe as a luxury experience. Also, if there is charge, I expect this to be clearly indicated on the website when booking. AC needs to re-consider its approach here. Is this a low-cost or a quality hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Good quality for the price paid.”
Reviews.Author: tothp17
Reviews.Content: Spacious and comfortable rooms. Good quality for the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice if you need to be near IESE”
Reviews.Author: APWLondon
Reviews.Content: Great business hotel in an unusual location for Barcelona, but if its near where you need to be I strongly recommend it. Great rooms and service.

Reviews.Title: “Very good except for air conditioning!”
Reviews.Author: emmanuel137
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as it was very close to where we needed to go - the location won't be perfect for everyone but it was for us. The bar was great, service excellent and everyone very friendly (and the quality of English spoken was better than we have experienced elsewhere in Spain including Madrid). The rooms were well apportioned and comfortable and the bathroom was a good size. The minor criticisms I have were that it would have been a little cleaner in the room (although that is me being quite picky), the room smelled a little of smoke (probably a historical issue as it is a difficult smell to get rid of) and the air conditioning in our room was not working properly, which gave is quite a hot night. I am sure they would have fixed it or moved us if we had said something but by the time we realised we were in bed and needed to get up early, so we couldn't be bothered to say anything as time was running short. We had dinner in the rooms which was fine - not exceptional but certainly passable. Free minibar was a nice touch which other hotels should do. I'm a picky traveller and it's rare that we find a perfect hotel (and this isn't), but despite that we are going to stay again when we go back in a few weeks time.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but internet by telefonica slow”
Reviews.Author: monicafros
Reviews.Content: i was there a few nights in april 2011 it was good refreshing holidays - good cleanliness, good location with a few minutes to metro station Maria Christina L3, close to nou camp (fc barcelona stadium - 10 minutes by foot), but slow internet (about 10 euros by 24h), parking (20 euros by night)

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect, rooms with lots of space to work or relax”
Reviews.Author: NetherlandsGijs
Reviews.Content: The staff is courteous and helpful. The rooms are actually spacious "suites" with semi-separated living/work and bed areas, as well as a bathroom (with tub/shower, closet, bidet, and faucet), a small balcony and a separate minibar area (with refrigerator and Nespresso coffee machine). The furniture is trendy and modern, and a TV plus stereo set (including a CD with lounge music) are available as well. Whereas the airco apparently could not blow cold air (perhaps shut off during the cold season?), opening the window to let in some fresh air did the job as well. There is enough space and facilities in the room to work and relax if you are not going out. The restaurant ("Neichel") is trendy and is said to have a Michelin star. The location is in a well-off living area and relatively quiet and close, to for example, the UPC University Campus and the CSIC Institute at the Jordi Girona Road. A church designed by Gaudi is also very nearby, on the other side of the Av. Pedralbes.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel overall, but needs to improve in a couple of areas”
Reviews.Author: DLHUK
Reviews.Content: The room was good, with a separate area with a sofa/table/two chairs, and a v.comfy bed. Bathroom good. All very modern and business-like. A large balcony with access from sleeping area and sitting area looked nice, it would be great in summer, as would their outdoor swimming pool. Just a few issues. We had a tiny kitchenette attached - it had a water heater/coffee maker that only gave out warm (not hot) water - a kettle would be better! Some of the food (buffet breakfast and room service) wasn't good. It wasn't very fresh. The chicken salad was deep fried chicken nuggets with salad and floppy bacon (ie, not very healthy). Same for goats cheese salad. And the worst, we ordered a chocolate desert that came with mould on it! It went back and of course it was taken off the bill (we didn't want a replacement...). The staff were professional and polite, however their English was limited, so I'm not sure they understood the problem (though the mould was visible!). We checked out at mid-day the next morning, and the food tray was still in the corridor where we'd left it the night before, we'd expected it to be collected the previous evening. Despite the food problems, we'd go back there again if we needed to be in that part of Barcelona - it isn't in the historic centre - but I wouldn't eat there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way”
Reviews.Author: DecoIreland
Reviews.Content: From the moment we booked to even after we had left,this hotel was excellent in every way. Bedroom+Separate sitting room c/w settee and proper desk and office chairs. Good sized bathroom. (could do with air extractor to remove condensation. Breakfast continental style with plentiful choice and constantly replenished. This is in a residential part of the city so to experience some nightlife you would have to travel into the city. Metro station a 10minute walk away. Taxi from Ramlas €9. On the evening we left, one of our party discovered in the airport that she had mislaid her cellphone either in the taxi taking her to the airport or left it in the hotel. The taxi driver found it and returned it to the hotel who then emailed me immediately and then posted it back to our colleague. If you want a good 4* hotel with a suite instead of a just a bedroom, nicely furnished at an extremely attractive price- then this is the place for you. All the staff so friendly and helpful. There is an excellent restaurant next door- Neichel, quality food, excellently presented- not cheap but excellent for that special night. (diiner - 3 courses approx €65-70)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for de high Diagonal area”
Reviews.Author: MarieMParis
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot to Barcelona for business, and I like to stay in different hotels so I can see different parts of the city on every trip. The Victoria Suites is an excellent choice if you have to visit a company located in the Diagonal area. The hotel is very confortable. Rooms are huge (they use to be appartments) and now they are suites without kitchen, but with different rooms (bed, living, dining, etc.). The minibar is free (coke, nuts, toblerone, etc.). The hotel has a very nice outdors swiming pool but the weather didn't let me use it. Staff is very nice and helpfull. I enjoied a lot my stay in the Victoria Suites, I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A nice trip”
Reviews.Author: MaxKarl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was good. The rooms are great, the pool is small but very nice and the breakfast are very good. We had a fair price by reserving on the website of AC Hotels, but even with that, it's not cheap. The location is quiet but you need to enjoy the metro because it's quite far from the historical center. There are a lot of places for shopping on Diagonal Avenue but not very much choice for eating. So again you need the metro. I recommend the place if you prefer a quiet calm place after a day of visits than a central place for late tapas and nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish room”
Reviews.Author: OldtimerEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights on business trip. Location was very convenient for public transport, though not city centre. Breakfast was very expensive.Staff were vey helpful and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Good week at Victoria Suites”
Reviews.Author: CCQueenAnne
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Victoria Suites for a week while in Barcelona for a conference. The location isn't perfect, it is about six blocks from the nearest metro stop. There's nothing interesting around the hotel, nothing of interest to a tourist. By the metro, however, are shopping and restaurants. The hotel is just off the beaten path (but in a very safe area, no worries about walking). I dealt with pretty much all of the front desk staff during my stay. Some were friendly from the get-go, most were pretty reserved, and one woman was downright unfriendly for the first half of my stay. However, she eventually warmed up to me as I worked hard at being nice. Still, it was pretty offputting to be paying a crazy nightly rate and have dismissive service at times. I will say that I had some odd requests and the front desk did have to go out of their way to serve me, which they did. My suite was new, modern and spotless. It began with an entryway alcove with a mini-fridge which held only beverages - free beverages! Sodas, waters and one beer, they were replenished daily. The next space was a parlor with a couch and coffee table, and a work desk. Internet (wi-fi) was expensive and had to be purchased at the front desk, you could buy cards for an hour or 24 hours. You couldn't use the same card for multiple computers, even if you were only using one machine at a time. There was a nice flat-screen TV on a rolling cart that you could roll to face the parlor or the bedroom. The only station in English was CNN. The beds would have been comfortable except that my king bed was two twins pushed together. Other rooms had true kings, so be sure to check before you settle on your room, if that is important to you. Two twins pushed together is as useful as one twin, since you can't stretch out. The bathroom was nice, modern, no complaints there. There was no air-conditioning available, though I think they do have it in the summer, but not the winter. But I thought the room was way too warm, especially overnight. My rate included the breakfast buffet, which was a wonderful spread of meats, cheeses, pastries, yogurt, cereal, fruits. Pretty much anything (cold) that you could desire. Had I been a tourist I would have eaten late and this would have more than covered lunch for me. Overall, I did have a good stay at this hotel. However, if I were picking again I'd try to get a hotel closer to the metro with better dining options around it.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in the university area”
Reviews.Author: AudreyO
Reviews.Content: The apartments are useful for a stay of several days, as you get a living area and kitchenette and balcony, but it lacks double glazing and can be somewhat noisy... the tile floors give them a cold look, though fine in summer. Shower heads were very poor. Breakfast was nice, as were the staff. A colleague was staying on the top floor and got a room, or what seemed like a suite, with a fantastic bathroom and lovely bed. I would recommend to take this if possible! 10 minute walk from the metro.

Reviews.Title: “good quality”
Reviews.Author: daniellugsden
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the victoria suites which is located on avra pedrables very near in the Nou Camp in Barcelona. The hotel has a four star standard and i think that was fair. Staff are very helpful, rooms are large, modern and have self catering facilites as well as large bathroom and living area. The hotel is located around a ten minutes walk from the football stadium and around 8 euros in a taxi from la rambla (centre of barcelona) Maria christina is the nearest metro stop which is a 5 minute walk down the diagonal (main street from hotel). A ticket for ten journeys is 6 euros which is well worth it. The best stop to get off for la rambla is Catalunya which is just at the top of this street and opposite the hard rock cafe. They ae so many good restaurant and bars and we tended to go around the plaza real which is (when walking down la rambla) on the rights by macdonalds Overall the hotel was great and a good time was had by all

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected from a 4*”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a weeks holiday in Barcelona. Myself, hubby and 2 kids. Hotel looked very nice from the outside. Reception area nice and clean, nothing special though. The room was quite big - a living area, 2 bedrooms and bathroom. Quite spacious but also very basic the rooms were clean. Swimmng pool was closed whilst we stayed there which was quite annoying although access to the pool was next to the main hotel entrance. Had breakfast only on the first day - quite disappointed with the choice and quality of food on offer, 10 euros per person too expensive !!!. The most annoying thing we found was the noise - we could hear people walking in the room above us; cars/lorries outside especially at around 11pm when the dustbin men come to empty the recycle bottle bins every night.. Would not rate this hotel as a 4 star - definitely 3 star. Would not go back although barcelona has limited family or hotels with adjoining rooms. Location was just outside the main city area very quiet and safe walked around at midnight no problems people and restaurants in area very nice. 10 mins from NU Camp and 5 min from tube station and bus stops including main tourist red route. Childrens small play area just outside hotel which the kids enjoyed. overall a okay hotel just spoilt by the breakfast, noise and lack of atmosphere.

HotelInfo.Name: AC Hotel Victoria Suites by Marriott
HotelInfo.Address: Calle Beltran i Rozpide, 7-9 | (antes Avda. Pedralbes, 16), 08034 Barcelona, Spain
